channel.title: The Homework Life
channel.description: The joys and pains of a high school career.

item.title: A Tutorial Lesson, Animated Circles, and Educational Programs
item.description: I worked with the new Programming Club after school today. An alumni worked us through a simple webpage themed like his webpage that used jQuery to position and animate. It was quite interesting, and I learned a simple, mathematical way to animate...

item.title: New Web Apps!
item.description: I've posted a new little web application, Speller Bee . I know that it should be "Spelling Bee," but that name was taken on Heroku (where the Node.js server is hosted) and therefore I chose something a little different to spice it up. It com...

item.title: Tarnish
item.description: If you've ever been an overextended, perfectionist high-school teenager, you'd understand. The homework life that I live is beginning to feel unattainable. In the end, you have to reach a compromise between quality and quantity . It's becoming a ...

item.title: Site Mixups!
item.description: img.rounded{border-radius:100%;width:250px;max-width:100%}table#newUpdateTable td:nth-of-type(1){width:250px;max-width:50%}table#newUpdateTable td{padding:10px 20px} There have been many major site improvements I made today! Many are graphical chan...

item.title: From Written Words to Spoken Meaning
item.description: What do I believe? Check it out at "As of February 2016" , a poem based off of "As of May 2002" by Del Shortliffe 1 . And another piece I have recently written, this time in response to Catcher in the Rye , is "Little Chained Bird" , a little vi...

item.title: Stampede!
item.description: I would be a student council officer for two reasons only: to have a leadership role for the National Honor Society , and to stop prom from soaking up all the studentsâ€™ money. Because, as a whole, fundraising does eventually end up going towards ...

item.title: Back to Coding and Posting!
item.description: Sorry for the lack of posting in the past few days. I have been busy with other projects, especially with Node.js , an amazing JavaScript platform. It's extremely confusing and frustrating right now, but I'm managing to slowly work my way through a...

item.title: Ageless
item.description: I go into a little fit of jealousy every time I hear someone about my age that does something amazing, or someone younger than me doing something better than I have. It's in my nature: I'm a competitive boy. But, in silent retaliation, I've decided ...

item.title: Goddam Profanities
item.description: "Holy s***!" " F this and F that!" It kills me. Cussing. Swearing. Cursing. Why do people do it? I understand when it happens every once in a while, when you drop a hammer on your foot or forget to do a homework assignment, but when has that kin...

item.title: The High School Life
item.description: I had this post idea lower on my to-do list, but its increased relevance to my life because of recent events has urged me to write about it immediately. Last week, a boy from my grade and six of his friends broke into the house of another boy becau...
